description: Borrowed from Latin ērectiō, ērectiōnis, noun of action from perfect passive participle ērectus, from verb erigō, from prefix ē- (“out of”) + regō, + action suffix -iō.

entries.meaning: (uncountable) The act of building or putting up or together of something.

examples: The Empire State Building was once the world's tallest erection.

entries.meaning: (uncountable or countable, ecclesiastical) Formal approval and official establishment of an institution such as a society or a monastery by higher church authorities.
(uncountable, physiology) The physiological process by which erectile tissue, such as a penis or clitoris, becomes erect by being engorged with blood.
(uncountable, physiology, of a penis or clitoris) The state or quality of being erect from engorgement with blood.
(countable) A penis or clitoris that is erect.
examples: Hyponyms: priapism, permaboner, death erection, morning wood
He placed his newspaper on his lap to hide his erection.
